body:
Salut Camille,

I assume you are using ActiveAdmin 0.2.2 which is not compatible with Rails 3.1.

Please use the latest master until we release ActiveAdmin 0.3.0.

A cio!

OK, I've that in my gem file :

```
gem 'meta_search', '>= 1.1.0.pre'
gem 'activeadmin', :git => 'git://github.com/gregbell/active_admin'
```

I've run a "bundle update" successfully, but I've a problem with the stylesheet asset now:

```
Started GET "/assets/active_admin.css" for 127.0.0.1 at 2011-08-12 16:38:34 +0200
Error compiling asset active_admin.css:
Sass::SyntaxError: File to import not found or unreadable: active_admin/mixins.
Load paths:
  /Users/[...]
  /Users/[...]/bundler/gems/active_admin-c3a1ffa98072/app/assets/stylesheets
  /Users/[...]/app/assets/stylesheets
  /Users/[...]/gems/compass-0.11.5/frameworks/compass/stylesheets
  (in /Users/[...]/assets/stylesheets/active_admin.css.scss)
Served asset /active_admin.css - 500 Internal Server Error
```

Sorry for disturbing you,
Thank you,
Camille

Hello Camille,

which version of rails 3.1 are you using? We can't reproduce this error on rails 3.1.0.rc5.

Cheers,

Here is my Gemfile.lock. I've rails 3.1.0.rc5:

I have the same error with ruby 3.1rc6, but it worked with rc4.

@camilleroux Please make sure your Gemfile contains

``` ruby
  gem "meta_search",    '>= 1.1.0.pre'
  gem 'sass-rails',     "~> 3.1.0.rc"
```

Greg should fix a failing css spec with 3.1rc6 tomorrow.

Double check your `Gemfile` and/or `config/application.rb` file, some subtle changes in the different rails 3.1 release candidates were the problem for me. You can always generate an empty rails app to see the differences.

From rc5 to rc6 this change in `config/application.rb` fixed this error :
`NoMethodError: undefined method 'asset_path' for #<Sass::Script::Functions::EvaluationContext:0x00000101d7e360>`

Removed:

``` ruby
# If you have a Gemfile, require the gems listed there, including any gems
# you've limited to :test, :development, or :production.
Bundler.require(:default, Rails.env) if defined?(Bundler)`
```

Added:

``` ruby
if defined?(Bundler)
  # If you precompile assets before deploying to production, use this line
  Bundler.require *Rails.groups(:assets => %w(development test))
  # If you want your assets lazily compiled in production, use this line
  # Bundler.require(:default, :assets, Rails.env)
end
```

from one of the earlier rc's to rc5 i had to change my `Gemfile` like pcreux described to get rid of this error :
`Sass::SyntaxError: File to import not found or unreadable: active_admin/mixins`

hope this helps
Thank you very much, it's working !

Regret to say I'm still having this issue... app started fresh in 3.1.1, tried 3.1.0, 3.1.1, 3.1.3 for deployment but no go.

Some relevant bits of my Gemfile.lock:

```
sass-rails (3.1.5)
activeadmin (0.3.3)
rails (3.1.3)
meta_search (>= 1.1.1)
```

Bundler line in application.rb as above: 

```
if defined?(Bundler)
   # If you precompile assets before deploying to production, use this line
    Bundler.require(*Rails.groups(:assets => %w(development test)))
    # If you want your assets lazily compiled in production, use this line
    # Bundler.require(:default, :assets, Rails.env)
end
```

The error looks very much like the ones above too:

```
A Sass::SyntaxError occurred in #:

 File to import not found or unreadable: active_admin/mixins.
Load paths:
Compass::SpriteImporter
/home/kyle/public_html/tseg_estimates/releases/20111208231643/public/stylesheets/sass
 /home/kyle/public_html/tseg_estimates/releases/20111208231643/app/assets/stylesheets
 /home/kyle/public_html/tseg_estimates/shared/bundle/ruby/1.9.1/gems/compass-0.11.5/frameworks/blueprint/stylesheets
 /home/kyle/public_html/tseg_estimates/shared/bundle/ruby/1.9.1/gems/compass-0.11.5/frameworks/compass/stylesheets
app/assets/stylesheets/active_admin.css.scss:2
```

I'm still dreaming about doing a Rails deployment that doesn't completely stress me out...  some day!
Thanks in advance for any comments, you would make my day.

Kyle
This error is to do with my Compass dependency.  I removed it and now it works fine.  Hmm.

@kpassa615 I recently ran into the same Compass::SpriteImporter issue during an upgrade to Rails 3.1.3 and found that we had an old compass.rb file located in:

```
/config/initializers
```

Removing this file fix my issue.

I had this issue with rails 3.2 and changing my `config/application.rb`:

```
# If you precompile assets before deploying to production, use this line
Bundler.require(*Rails.groups(:assets => %w(development test)))
# If you want your assets lazily compiled in production, use this line
# Bundler.require(:default, :assets, Rails.env)
```

to this:

```
# If you precompile assets before deploying to production, use this line
# Bundler.require(*Rails.groups(:assets => %w(development test)))
# If you want your assets lazily compiled in production, use this line
Bundler.require(:default, :assets, Rails.env)
```

Seems to have solved the issue for me
darrenterhune's solution solved this for me.
darrenterhune's solution solved for me, too! Thanks.
